meanings.definition: The property of being toxic to the ear or its nerve supply.
meanings.sent1: The doctor warned about the ototoxicity of the medication, which could harm my hearing.
meanings.sent2: Researchers are studying ways to reduce ototoxicity in chemotherapy drugs to protect patients' ears.
meanings.sent3: The cartoon character wore earmuffs to shield himself from the ototoxicity of the loud music.
meanings.sent4: The ototoxicity of the loud noise in the city streets slowly eroded her ability to hear clearly.
meanings.sent5: The vivid description of ototoxicity made me realize the importance of protecting my ears from harm.

meanings.definition: The ability of certain substances to cause damage to the ear or hearing.
meanings.sent1: The ototoxicity of the chemical was evident when the patient experienced sudden hearing loss.
meanings.sent2: Musicians should be aware of the ototoxicity of prolonged exposure to loud music.
meanings.sent3: The comedy skit humorously portrayed the ototoxicity of the ear-damaging potion.
meanings.sent4: The ototoxicity of the gossip spread through the office, damaging relationships.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's vivid explanation of ototoxicity helped the students understand the importance of ear protection.
